slide.text: "Using Java we can code: issue a command to the computer to do something, such as print text on the screen."
"A command to print text on the screen will look something like this:"
"Java commands are all in English, without spaces between the words. Every word starts with a capital letter."
"This type of writing is called camelCase, because the shape of the words is similar to a camel’s humps."
"The new text is written next to the command, in brackets and inside quotation marks."
"Every Java command ends with a semicolon."
"This is one of many commands the computer knows how to execute."
"The programmer uses multiple commands that the computer knows how to execute, in order to make the computer to perform more complicated actions."

exercise.question: "Every Java command ends with a period."
"Text in commands is written between quotation marks."
